byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard contributed reporting from Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

abstract: Saudi Arabia responds negatively to decision by lawmakers in United States Congress to override Pres Obama's veto of contentious law that would allow families of Sept 11 terror attacks victims to pursue legal claims against Saudi government; vote changes decades-old sovereign immunity law protecting foreign governments from American lawsuits, and is likely to lead to years of court battles.
lead_paragraph: Families of Sept. 11 victims are now able to pursue legal claims against the Saudis, and the legal battle could last for years.
snippet: Families of Sept. 11 victims are now able to pursue legal claims against the Saudis, and the legal battle could last for years....

headline.main: Claims of Saudi Role in 9/11 Appear Headed for Manhattan Court
headline.print_headline: New Law Shifts Fight on Claims for 9/11 Victims
